perturbation.original_text: k) Conduct: Agent shall undertake no acts injurious to the business or goodwill of Kallo. Agent shall use its best efforts to promote Kallo and its products and service and shall promptly report and follow up all leads provided.  Agent may not offer or promote competitive products without the consent of Kallo.
perturbation.changed_text: k) Conduct: Agent shall undertake no acts injurious to the business or goodwill of Kallo. Agent shall use its best efforts to promote Kallo and its products and service and shall promptly report and follow up all leads provided.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause 'Agent may not offer or promote competitive products without the consent of Kallo.', we create a contradiction if, for example, section 3(f) states that Agent agrees to market Kallo exclusively. Now, the agent's obligation is uncertain, raising enforceability issues.

perturbation.original_text: d) Payment terms: For each Kallo Mobile care suite of products license ordered by Agent from Kallo, Agent shall  pay to Kallo the transfer price set forth in Schedule A. 50% of the total amount to be paid with the signed purchase  order, 35% upon shipping of the goods to the carrier at Canadian port and 15% upon completion of the installation.  Upon delivery of the system the Agent is responsible for getting the signed EULA from the customer before the  installation process starts.
perturbation.changed_text: d) Payment terms: For each Kallo Mobile care suite of products license ordered by Agent from Kallo, Agent shall  pay to Kallo as per mutually agreed terms. Upon delivery of the system the Agent is responsible for getting the signed EULA from the customer before the  installation process starts.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit payment percentages and replacing it with 'as per mutually agreed terms', while Schedule A still lists specific percentages, creates a contradiction. Enforcement becomes challenging as the main body lacks specifics.

perturbation.original_text:
9.Maintenance:

A.Mobile Clinic and Command Center maintenance is included in the Five year Standard Mandatory Maintenance as per the  Program description given in Schedule E
perturbation.changed_text:
9.Maintenance:

A.Mobile Clinic and Command Center maintenance details are included in Schedule E
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'Five year Standard Mandatory Maintenance as per the Program description', but still referring to Schedule E, an inconsistency arises. Schedule E is supposed to indicate details for the "Five year Standard Mandatory Maintenance", however such is non-existent.
